name: Uranium(III) chloride
desc: Uranium(III) chloride, UCl3, is a chemical compound that contains the earth metal uranium and chlorine. UCl3 is used mostly to reprocess spent nuclear fuel. Uranium(III) chloride is synthesized in various ways from uranium(IV) chloride; however, UCl3 is less stable than UCl4.
Other names:
Uranium chloride
Uranium trichloride
Hypouranous chloride
Related compounds:
Uranium(IV) chloride,
Uranium(V) chloride,
Uranium(VI) chloride
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
